meanings.definition: The power derived from the energy of falling water or fast running water, used for generating electricity or mechanical power.
meanings.sent1: Hydropowers are harnessed to create electricity from flowing water.
meanings.sent2: The hydropowers of the river were used to light up the entire town.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to use hydropowers to power its tiny acorn-shaped spaceship.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like a dam holding back the hydropowers of her imagination.
meanings.sent5: The roaring waterfall demonstrated the immense force of hydropowers.

meanings.definition: The ability to generate electricity or mechanical power using the energy of falling water or fast running water.
meanings.sent1: Hydropowers can be a sustainable source of energy for many communities.
meanings.sent2: The ancient water mill relied on hydropowers to grind grains into flour.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's secret lair was powered by mysterious hydropowers hidden beneath the city.
meanings.sent4: The inventor's mind was a turbine, efficiently utilizing the hydropowers of innovation.
meanings.sent5: The small village prospered thanks to the reliable hydropowers of the nearby stream.
